statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Up next for Bulls: Saint Joseph's
article.story:
AMHERST, N.Y. (AP) -- Mark Bortz had 20 points and Turner Battle
added 19 to lift Buffalo to an 81-76 overtime win over Drexel in
the opening round of the NIT on Wednesday night.

	   Buffalo (23-9), which lost on a last-second shot to Ohio in the
Mid-American Conference championship game, advanced to the first
round and will play Saint Joseph's.

	   Mario Jordan contributed 12 points in the win for the Bulls, who
have never played in the postseason as a Division I school.

	   Jeremiah King had a career-high 25 points to lead Drexel (17-12)
of the Colonial Athletic Association. Dominick Mejia added 17
points and Phil Goss had 14 as the Dragons lost their second
straight game.

	   The first meeting between the teams turned into a memorable one.
The game featured 14 lead changes before Battle sent it into
overtime with a spinning layup with 1.7 seconds left.

	   Drexel pulled ahead 62-54 with 5:18 remaining in the second half
when Goss made a 10-foot jump shot, but Buffalo responded with an
11-3 run, capped by Calvin Cage's 3-pointer, to tie the score with
just over a minute to go.

	   In overtime, Buffalo took its biggest lead, 76-72, after Jordan
converted two free throws. The Bulls connected on 8 of 10 foul
shots in the extra session, and limited the Dragons to 29 percent
shooting in the second half.
